answers.answer: Hi there, my name is Gina  I come on this forum everyday to check on others people comment and to see how they are doing and how they copy with this disease. My daughter she is 25 years old an LPN right now and 3 month away to graduate from College with a bachelor degree in nursing. I suppose to be happy  but she is the one to get diagnosed with Lupus and that makes me very worry and unhappy. I cannot stop crying. I see you've been deal with this disease  for 14 years. Please let me know the ups and downs and how you menage to work full time. I know my daughter have hard time, everyday she deals with joint pain goes to school full time,  works full time and double weekends. I was hoping after graduating everything will be much easier when we find out she might have Lupus. Lot of stress over those years of college and work caught  out with her. Take care and good luck with your school.

question: Hello everyone! I am new to this site. I am a nurse and I live in Texas. I have been living with lupus for many years. I was diagnosed in 1994. I now have heart disease, diabetes (I am on insulin), & fibromyalgia. I have been married for almost 41 years and have a son and a daughter. I only have one grandson who is 16. He's very spoiled! I also have 3 poodles that are my babies! They make me happy and keep me going. I had a angiogram on Friday and am home recouperating. I had two large areas of blockage in my left anterior descending artery. One between the two stents I had place back about 3-4 years ago and another area below that one. When they went in and did the angiogram, it didn't show up like they thought it would so I believe all the prayers that folks sent up for me worked! I was so happy because they thought I might need to have a bypass and I sure didn't want that! Anyway, I just wanted to say hello and I will check in now and then to see what's going on. I work full time as the Chief Nursing officer at a local rehabilitation hospital and am going to school trying to get my master's degree in nursing, so I stay very busy. Wishing you all a pain free week! God Bless! Susan
